did.unittitle: The Legislative Correspondents' Association of the State of New York Records
did.abstract: This collection contains materials about The Legislative Correspondents' Association of the State of New York, especially its celebrated annual dinner held since 1900.
did.physloc: The materials are located onsite in the department.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: 2019, 2022 and 2024 accessions processed in 2025 by Meghan Slaff.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is primarily unrestricted. There is one restricted box of two autographed show programs within the second series, access can be provided upon request.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: This page may contain links to digital objects. Access to these images and the technical capacity to download them does not imply permission for re-use. Digital objects may be used freely for personal reference use, referred to, or linked to from other web sites.
Researchers do not have permission to publish or disseminate material from these collections without permission from an archivist and/or the copyright holder.

The researcher assumes full responsibility for conforming to the laws of copyright. Some materials in these collections may be protected by the U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) and/or by the copyright or neighboring-rights laws of other nations. More information about U.S. Copyright is provided by the Copyright Office. Additionally, re-use may be restricted by terms of University Libraries gift or purchase agreements, donor restrictions, privacy and publicity rights, licensing and trademarks.
The Department of Special Collections and Archives is eager to hear from any copyright owners who are not properly identified so that appropriate information may be provided in the future.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Current and former members of The Legislative Correspondents Association of New York State Susan Arbetter, Kyle Hughes, and Ron Kermani donated the materials in this collection to the M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections & Archives in 2015-2016. Kyle Hughes donated additional materials in 2019 and 2022. The 2022 accession contained the LCA show files of longtime stage manager Jill Coloney. In 2024, Miranda Spivack donated a small number of files from her late father, Robert Spivack, who was past president of the organization and Michael Carrese, a former member of the organization, also donated a small amount of material.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The Legislative Correspondents' Association of the State of New York (LCA), which began in 1890, is composed of journalists covering the State Capitol in Albany. It is said to be one of the oldest organizations of newspapermen in the country. It was not until 1965 that women were permitted to join the LCA, although they were correspondents at the capital at the time. This Collection reflects the organization as a whole rather than specific reporters, with the exception of those referenced in the subject files.

The LCA holds a dinner and satirical show each year, since the inaugural one given for Governor Theodore Roosevelt in 1900, poking fun at New York politics and politicians. The program has grown from the simple beginnings of dinner and hijinks to the elaborate show put on for several hundred state politicians and guests that we have today. The proceeds from the show go to help local charities throughout New York State.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection includes administrative and financial records, correspondence, photographs, slides, and member files from The Legislative Correspondents' Association of the State of New York (LCA). The majority of the collection, however, consists of materials from the LCA's annual dinner and show, including programs, invitations, tickets, seating charts, scripts and actor's materials, video, audio, film, and songs.
Please note that not all dates are inclusive.

arrangement.head: Arrangement of the Collection
arrangement.p: The materials are arranged chronologically within each of the three series.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Preferred citation for this material is as follows:

Identification of specific item, series, box, folder, The Legislative Correspondents' Association of the State of New York Records, 1892-2024. M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives, University Libraries, University at Albany, State University of New York (hereafter referred to as the The Legislative Correspondents' Association of the State of New York Records).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Administrative series consists of Board and business meeting minutes, constitutions, proposed changes to the constitution, annual and executive meeting files, files of some Club Presidents, some show planning, finances, and budgets. It houses some of the earliest records about the organization. This series also contains information about membership, but not in depth information on specific reporters.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains information specific to the LCA's annual show. The files contain information about a specific year's show including: finances, invoices, programs, scripts, invitations, correspondence, committees, attendees, menus, videos, photographs, and slides. The 2024 accession has granted almost all of the show programs in the Association's history. This series contains the bulk of the collection starting with the earliest show program dated 1902.
Some early show information may also be found in the administration series, where it was comingled with executive and membership materials.

odd.head: General
odd.p: This item contains derogatory and potentially harmful depictions of minority communities. These representations reflect the prejudices and biases of the time in which they were created and may be offensive or distressing. We present this material as part of the historical record, not as an endorsement of the views it contains.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains reference material that may have been used by the correspondents when researching topics for a story. It also contains subject files of Ray Borst and Robert Fusco, who were very active throughout their professional lives in the LCA. Some of Robert Fusco's articles are housed in a seperate flate file.
The flat file that contains the article "Corruption Uncorked in New York" is part of the file labeled "Kisburg-Gruntner Key Incident."
